name: Alexa Rodriguez
short_bio: Chef Alexa is a James Beard Award winner with over 15 years of experience in the culinary industry.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat grill to high heat. Season the steak with salt and pepper. Grill the steak for 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare. Let the steak rest for 5 minutes before slicing. For the chimichurri sauce, blend garlic, parsley, oregano, red wine vinegar, and olive oil in a food processor. Serve the steak with chimichurri sauce.

Cook pasta in salted water until al dente. In a skillet, sauté garlic in butter until fragrant. Add shrimp and cook until pink. Add lemon juice and white wine. Simmer for a few minutes until the sauce thickens. Toss with cooked pasta and serve.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Slice eggplant, zucchini, and red bell pepper into rounds. Thinly slice the onion. In a baking dish, arrange the vegetables in a spiral pattern. Top with minced garlic and drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 45-50 minutes until the vegetables are tender. Serve hot or at room temperature.
